courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Clinical Molecular Genetics
courses.description: The course covers [1] understanding of DNA structure, human genome and application of various molecular techniques in current clinical molecular laboratory including PCR technique, Southern analysis, targeted mutation analysis, gene scanning, gene sequencing, SNP array analysis , next generation sequencing, identity testing; [2] developing preanalytic and postanalytic skills including interpretation of test results, report writing and communication of result to clinicians.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: The students are expected to learn the basic principle and advanced knowledge on clinical and molecular genetics
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be proivded in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommendedÂ readings will be proivded in the first lesson.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Clinical Biochemical Genetics
courses.description: Understanding [1]genetic basis of inborn errors of metabolism[2] the acute presentation of inborn errors of metabolism such as hypoglycaemia, metabolic acidosis, hyperammonemia and other metabolic crisis[3] the interpretation of abnormal screening test results [4] how to apply the principles of effective communication in taking care of patients with or at-risk of specific genetic conditions.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire general assessment skills and investigation methods for inborn errors of metabolism.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Clinical Genetics
courses.description: Clinical genetics deals with direct clinical care of patients with genetic disease, including diagnosis, management and counselling as well as development of a genomic approach to human diseases in clinical setting which requires the application of all of the basic principles of medical genetics taught in this course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics and MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire the diagnosis, management and counselling skills.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Clinical Cytogenetics
courses.description: The course covers the understanding of DNA and its architecture, cell division and the use of various techniques to examine these structures, including chromosome banding, FISH and array CGH. It also covers the application of these techniques for the detection of chromosomal abnormalities, developing preanalytic and postanalytic skills in test results interpretation, report writing and communication of result to clinicians.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics and MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to understand and be able to conduct karyotyping analysis on prenatal and postnatal samples including result interpretation and write up report.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Population Genetics
courses.description: The course covers [1] risk assessment of a given genetic condition [2] implications of population screening for carriers of disease causing genes [3] gene mapping and identification of genes responsible for the predisposition to disease like cancers and autism [4] interpretation of DNA matching for paternity testing or forensic purposes [5] study of world-wide genetic variation among human populations.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on population genetics.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Genome informatics
courses.description: The course introduces the basic concepts, methods and tools used in bioinformatics including bioinformatics databases, sequence alignment and phylogeny, protein structure prediction, protein-protein interaction, molecular dynamics and other essential data mining algorithms with the aim of helping students to use bioinformatics tools and data to answer biological questions and to solve clinical problems.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on genome informatics, including access to public database and conduct data analysis.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Genetic Counselling
courses.description: Genetic counselling is a communication process which involves [1] conveying medical facts including diagnosis, course of the disorder and available treatment[2] understanding the pattern of inheritance and the risk of carrying the gene in specific relatives [3] understanding the alternatives for dealing with the risk [4] choosing an appropriate course of action by taking into account their risk, family goals, ethical and religious standard, and in accordance with their decision[5] making the best possible adjustment to the disorder of the affected family member and/or the risk of recurrence of the disorder.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics and MSc Obstetric Care and MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology and MSc Obstetric and Midwifery Care
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge and skill on genetic counselling, especially common cancer including hematological cancers.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Cancer Genetics
courses.description: This course focuses primarily on hematological malignancies including leukemia, lymphoma and myeloma, and will cover their pathogenesis and use of molecular and cytogenetic techniques for diagnosis, prognostication and treatment.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on cancer genetics, especially common cancer including hematological cancers
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.

courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Scientific Skills, Laboratory Safety and Management
courses.description: [1] Presentation and communication skills: This module will cover generation, transmission and reception of messages; conflict resolution and negotiation; defining objectives; modes of presentation and communication including prompts, ideas, memos, letters, resumes, proposals, tenders, posters, theses, research papers and grant applications; critical analysis, argument and opinion; plagiarism and citation; presentation skills including poster and oral presentations, public speaking, interview and phone interview; use of audio-visual aids.[2] Laboratory safety: It covers biosafety levels; laboratory containment, design and facilities; laboratory equipment; fire and electrical safety; guidelines and code of practice; safety organization and surveillance; safety checklist, trainingprogramme and rules for supportive staff; disinfection, decontamination and disposal of bio-hazardous, chemical and radioactive waste.[3] Laboratory management: It deals with the organization of core laboratory and reference laboratory, laboratory practice regulations, implementation and monitoring of laboratory safety, equipment evaluation, financial budgeting and controlling, tendering, stock taking, auditing, decision making, formulation of laboratory policies and standard operating procedure, laboratory accreditation, personnel management, handling conflicts in work environment.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics and MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to understand acquire up-to-date knowledge on Scientific Presentation and communication skills, Laboratory safety and management.
courses.course_syllabus: The topics will be stated in the course timetable and it will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Prenatal and Paediatric Genetics
courses.description: The course deals with prenatal dysmorphology and genetic syndromes. It will also cover the principles of prenatal screening and diagnosis with emphasis on screening for Down syndrome and other fetal aneuploidies.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on prenatal genetics.
courses.course_syllabus:
Prenatal genetic diagnosis by Whole Exome Sequencing  
Prenatal genetic diagnosis by chromosome analysis (FISH + karyotyping)  
Prenatal genetic diagnosis by PCR and aCGH  
Prenatal genetic diagnosis by circulating cell free DNA  
PGS and PGD  
Genetic counseling of prenatal diagnosis (selected case)  
Ultrasound diagnosis of fetal viral infection  
Laboratory diagnosis of fetal viral infection  
Disease involving non-coding DNA  
Genetics and miscarriage  
Genetics in Mental Retardation   
Genetics and female infertility  
Case sharing  
Lab attachment - prenatal screening lab  
Lab attachment - cyto genetic lab  
Lab attachment - molecular dignostic lab  
Lab attachment - Laboratory IEM  
Lab attachment - SafeT21express  
Clinical Attachment - genetic counselling
courses.feedback_evaluation: Online evaluation will be arranged at the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: The required readings will be provided in the first lesson.
courses.recommended_readings: The recommended readings will be provided in the first lesson.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Adult and Cancer Genetics
courses.description: The course covers the diagnosis, counseling and management of late onset genetic diseases, common hereditary cancers and cancer predisposition syndromes. It also includes the quantitative methods in cancer risk assessment, laboratory methods of cancer genetic testing, genetic testing in the management of patients with cancer, reproductive counseling for cancer patients and families.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on adult genetics and cancer genetics in advanced level.
courses.course_syllabus:
DNA Breakage Disorders  
Neurodegeneration (Parkinson, Alzheimer, & related disorders)   
BRCA1/2   
Mitochondrial Disorers (MELAS, MERRF, NARP, MNGIE, Kearns-Sayers, etc.)   
Cancer Genetic Syndromes II (Solid)   
Hereditary Sensory Motor Neuropathies - head and neck region with some peripheral neuropathies   
Hereditary Colon Cancer   
"Hereditary Sensory Motor Neuropathies - genes and hearing  
Marfan Syndrome & Related Disorders   
Case sharing   
Cancer Genetic Syndromes I   
Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome   
Hereditary Cardiomyopathy and Cardiac Conductions Defects   
Triplet Repeat Disorders in Adults (Spinocerebellar ataxias, myotonic dystrophy, etc.)   
Clinical attachment - genetic counselling

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Advanced Clinical Genetics
courses.description: The course teaches recognizable patterns of human malformation using a combined approach encompassing dysmorphology, formulation of diagnosis, advanced laboratory testing, management and therapy.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on clinical genetics in advanced level.
courses.course_syllabus:
11p15 abnormalities  
Collagen II related disorders   
Autistic Spectrum Disorders  
Channelopathies  
Genetics of Senses   
Ciliopathies  
Citrin deficiency  
Genetics of disorders of sex development   
Disorders of Sex Development  
Inherited bone marrow failure disorders   
Dysmorphology I  
Dysmorphology II  
Gene therapy  
22q11 deletion and duplication  
Human Subject Research  
Prenatal USG and Genetic diagnosis of Urinary tract malformation   
Modeling Human disease in non-human species  
Fragile X Syndrome  
Rett syndrome and X-inactivation  
Robert Syndrome (Centromere Maintenance)  
Skin Disorder/Dermatogenetics/Somatic mosaicism  
Thalassemia  
UPD/Imprinting Disorders  
Mitochondrial replacement

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Frontiers in Genomic Medicine and Laboratory Technologies
courses.description: The course introduces the latest concepts, methods and tools used in genomic medicine with the aim to provide an in-depth knowledge on how to answer biological questions. Special emphasis will be put on the application and interpretation of microarray and next-generation sequencing data.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on genomic medicine and laboratory technologies.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Ethics and Law
courses.description: The course deals with psychological, ethical and legal issues in prenatal genetic testing, cancer genetic testing and reproductive genetic testing, and problem of confidentiality.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on ethics and law in medical genetics.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Research Project
courses.description: Research topics related to genomic and clinical genetics will be provided by the principal investigators from the Chinese University of Hong Kong, Baylor College of Medicine, Harvard Medical School and Peking Union Medical College. The research project will either be a laboratory-based or clinical data-based investigation. Students are required to write up the result in a dissertation.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to demonstrate competency in the application of research methodologies. In adedition, they are able to synthesise and critically evaluate published information and present it in written format.

courses.subject: CNGT
courses.title: Prenatal and Adult Genetics
courses.description: Part 1 - Prenatal GeneticsThe course deals with prenatal dysmorphology and genetic syndromes. It will also cover the principles of prenatal screening and diagnosis with emphasis on screening for Down syndrome and other fetal aneuploidies.Part 2 - Adult GeneticsThe course covers the diagnosis, counseling and management of late onset genetic diseases. It includes BRCA1/2, hereditary colon cancer, cancer genetic syndromes I (Haemat), cancer genetic syndromes, DNA breakage disorders, Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, Marfan syndrome & related disorders, hereditary cardiomyopathy and cardiac conductions defects, neurodegeneration (Parkinson, Alzheimer, & related disorders), hereditary sensory motor neuropathies, genes and hearing, hereditary sensory motor neuropathies, head and neck region with some peripheral neuropathies, triplet repeat disorders in adults and mitochondrial disorders.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Medical Genetics
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire up-to-date knowledge on prenatal and adult genetics in advanced level.
